Help people overcome addictions: By making people tell the truth about their addiction, they may be more likely to seek help and overcome their addiction.
Improve relationships: By making people tell the truth about their feelings and thoughts, relationships can be improved and deepened.
Reduce gossip and rumors: By making people tell the truth about what they know, rumors and gossip could be reduced and people could be held accountable for spreading false information.
Improve workplace communication: By making people tell the truth about their work performance, projects can be completed more efficiently and effectively.

Improve political transparency: By making politicians and public officials tell the truth about their actions and decisions, the public can make informed decisions and hold them accountable for their actions.
